data.title: Mistranslation in Japanese
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

The **Go** menu **Forward** is translated as 転送 in Japanese.
We usually translate "forward" which is the antonym of "back" as "次へ" which is the antonym of "戻る".
"転送" is a word for email.
Thank you!

data.title: ReplaceService: directly disposing IModel should be avoided
data.body:
I am hunting through our code to find areas where `IModel` is being disposed directly without going through our reference counted world. Besides file/untitled land that are known to not have this adopted, the only other place I found was in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/search/browser/replaceService.ts#L80

@sandy081 you are directly disposing IModel, basically bypassing our reference counting lifecycle model. Is there any reason? This is ugly because it means in my world I also have to listen to `IModel` getting disposed to dispose my models.

I am unsure why you actually need to first resolve a file reference and then create a new model, could you not just use the same model for the left hand side of the diff editor?

fyi @joaomoreno

data.title: Change to Powershell breaks workflow for Elixir
data.body:
VSCode Versions 1.9 - 2.0
Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Elixir following the [official docs}(http://elixir-lang.org/install.html)
2. Install VSCode version < 1.9
3. Press ctrl + \` to open VSCode's command line
4. Elixir REPL can be started with `iex` and `mix` tasks work as expected.
5. Upgrade VSCode and reopen it
6. Press ctrl + \` to open VSCode's command line
7. Both `iex` and `mix` now fail.

1. start VS Code Insider on a vscode workspace
2. open settings

data.title: Intellisense in sass is confusing
data.body:
While using itellisense within sass file, i've noticed that the proposed list of values is huge and arranged in alphabetical order.  I think it much more useful when the order is based on type of value. Is is possible?
![default](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9945452/23502183/b8644472-ff58-11e6-85dd-7023e3cf9ed2.png)

data.title: AltGr (Right Alt) issues (HU keyboard layout) with plugins (or other Ctrl+Alt+ keybindings)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Install plugin (RestAPI client or Deploy for example)
2. Press right alt + F ( '[' character ) or right alt + C ( '&' ) and it fires the plugin's shortcut which is defined as Ctrl+Alt+F, etc.

Is there a fix apart from rebinding the plugin keymaps all the time?

data.title: Keybindings editor's info tooltips are misaligned
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3 & Windows 10 (both in french)

The info tooltip displaying the keybinding in the current keyboard layout is not aligned with the key combinations and some info tooltips are displayed where there is no key combination. The key displayed on the tooltip text for these bogus tooltips is ";"

The cursor position is also misaligned on lines with info tooltips. 

In the screenshot, the cursor is at the end of line 3, typing text will insert it after the comma, but the cursor is displayed 2 characters before. On line 7 the cursor will be displayed 4 characters before. The rest of a line after a word-wrap is not affected.

![capture d ecran 2017-03-02 a 10 32 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1919205/23501303/ad6f8614-ff33-11e6-99fc-fb04825a67b1.png)

This affects the user's keybinding.json editor and the Default key combinations editor. The issue was already present in VSCode 1.9.

data.title: Error processing "setBreakpoints" on console using new inspector protocol, but breakpoint works
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

I have a project with node in typescript with sourcemaps.
Using this configuration:


            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "protocol": "auto",
            "name": "Iniciar programa",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\src\\app.ts",
            "outFiles": [ "${workspaceRoot}\\dist\\**\\*.js" ]


With the new inspector protocol I have an error on console when I set or remove a breakpoint when debugging, but the breakpoint works.
Console output when I set or remove a breakpoint:
`Error processing "setBreakpoints": Error: Set breakpoints request timed out
    at Timeout.setTimeout (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug2\node_modules\vscode-chrome-debug-core\out\src\utils.js:55:24)
    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:232:11)
    at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:202:5)
Thu, 02 Mar 2017 09:04:15 GMT express deprecated req.host: Use req.hostname instead at <anonymous>:1:49`

data.title: Option to choose quotes for add missing import feature
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `class A implements B {}`
2. Use the new quick fix option to "import B from x".
3. Works, but uses double quotes for the import path (`import { B } from "x"`), which breaks linting in projects configured with single quotes only (like Angular ones).
